result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

On one or more charges in this case, Cedric C Kinjerski was found not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect. The defendant was found guilty of actually committing the crime(s) charged, but was also found not to be legally responsible under Wis. Stats. 971.165 for committing the crime(s) because of the defendant's mental condition. The legal effect of a finding of not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect is that the court must commit the defendant to the custody of the Department of Health and Family Services.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Cases 15CM1373, 15CF1308, 15CM370, and 16CF1014 called.  Attorney Kelsey Morin in court.   Defendant Cedric C Kinjerski did not appear.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is in custody in the Waukesha County Jail and is refusing to come out to court.  Parties address the defendant's refusal and competency.  Attorney Morin advises the jail is not allowing the defendant to have any sort of visitors and requests and order of the court to be able to see the defendant.  Attorney Morin advises the defendant is not getting his medications in the jail as well.  Attorney Morin makes statements regarding the no contact order with the defendant's grandmother.  Court does not have the new cases to be able to make a decision on the no contact order.  Court orders attorney Morin to go to the jail and see what they have to say and return to the courtroom.  Case recalled at 3:54 pm.  Court added the newest case 16CF1014 to the hearing today.  Attorney Morin feels we need to wait until the competency is addressed on the new case.  Court raises the issue of competency on all cases.  Older cases stayed.  New case 16CF1014 is left on to be heard before the court commissioner on 9/9/2016.  Hearing scheduled for October 7, 2016 at 09:30 am.  Check Case scheduled for October 3, 2016 at 08:00 am.
